Comments are good for making code readable, but often you will want longer sections of text, mixed in with both the code you a running and the outputs of the code (e.g. the plots you are making with it). Do this with Rmarkdown. A Rmarkdown file is a plain text file, like a R script, but with the extension .Rmd'' rather than.R''. You can make one now in RStudio by clicking File > New File > R Markdown. Or by saving an existing .R script as filename.Rmd. RMarkdown is the system which marks how text should look after it has been converted into a webpage or PDF or other document. The name RMarkdown is kind of a joke, since RMarkdown is a verion of a "markup langauge". Markups are the opposite of the WYSIWYG systems (like MS word or Google Docs) which you are used to. These pages are written in Rmarkdown. You can see this individual file here in the online repositry.
